text: Yemen I keep repeating the word in my
head and pinching my arm am I really in
Yemen right now I'm sure most of the
information you've heard about Yemen and
come from the TV or Internet and thus
it's probably frightening there's
absolutely no denying that is unsafe to
visit to be honest with you I've never
felt more on edge in my life than this
past week in Yemen but if I push myself
to see through the war in political
situation I'm absolutely loving this
place so far if I had to describe Yemen
in one word it would be raw as one of
the most impoverished and religious
countries in the world life here is life
in its purest form and it's beautiful
there are no recognizable brands on the
streets in fact every restaurant has the
exact same menu goat chicken rice Kobus
vegetables there's absolutely no place
to get sushi or tacos this video is
going to show you everything that you
haven't heard about Yemen because few
places have captured my heart quite like
this one starting with the untouched
nature
[Applause]
this caught me by surprise the most I
was expecting all of Yemen to be a
desert and while most of it is I saw
lots of greenery especially near the
Omani border and I also saw incredible
valleys that reminded me of the Grand
Canyon when it comes to historical sites
I've never seen completely untouched
ancient ones like I've seen in Yemen in
the Hydra map state most of the homes
and buildings are made from mud bricks
and some of them are over 600 years old
now we are in Chiba Manhattan it's the
world heritage
it's the First's houses in like Valley
on HUD remote fact Yemen has
surprisingly outstanding food
Kobus I love this stuff the cuisine is
so unique to the point that it deserves
its own category some dishes like this
one called satay I've never tasted until
now they also love eating goat chicken
and rice and always eat sitting on the
floor with their hands last but not
least I can't leave Yemen without
telling you about the amazing people and
this one was expected I already knew
that the hospitality will be like others
in the Arab world and my expectations
that were exceeded Yemeni people are not
aggressive at all they want peace they
are always smiling
they are always offering me tea or food
or a bed to sleep in at first I was
hesitant to tell people my nationality
but once I did I received only curiosity
and no hatred do you like America
yes he does Wow nice going seen it was
that Jesse not the one that is a Python
I'm a hundred percent sure that Yemen
would be a tourist haven if there wasn't
a war and I'm hopeful that within the
next half decade things will progress
and open up and return and thrive like
it used to be
